results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description: Family ties are often a fragile thing, as Simon is about to discover as he unravels the secrets of one man’s childhood. A haunting look at the issues facing modern family life.

results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description: A beautiful mediation on the meaning of family and blood ties. Photographs and home movies of the past form the extent of one man’s childhood memory of his father. In attempting to recover his past, he discovers that time’s absences and betrayals are apt to be repeated.

results.title: Relationships
results.brief_description: Starting, ending and maintaining relationships is never easy. Peter Quarry leads couples through the minefield and discusses: What attracts people to each other, how to turn a friendship into something deeper, how to keep a relationship alive, conflict, resolution, knowing when to quit, being single and enjoying it.

results.title: Reinventing Japan
results.creator_credit: PBI Productions, Jigsaw Productions, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Teleac Holland and Alex Gibney
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program looks at the peculiar relationship between Japan and the United States that emerged in the wake of World War II. Set to the tunes of big band jazz and including footage of the period never before seen, “Reinventing Japan” captures the spirit of a strange era, full of idealism and democracy as well as bitter betrayals, when one country tried to reinvent another in its image - with surprising and unexpected results.

results.title: Reinforcement therapy
results.brief_description: Presents three experimental programs that apply learning therapy or operant conditioning, to the treatment of severely disturbed autistic children, to the training of retarded children and to the treatment of chronic schizophrenic adult patients.

results.title: Reilly: ace of spies: an affair with a married woman
results.creator_credit: Euston Films, Chris Burt and Jim Goddard
results.brief_description: Sidney Reilly, said to have been the inspiration for James Bond, was probably the greatest spy the world has ever known. A rogue, womaniser, and brilliant tactician, he thrived on danger, performing extraordinary feats that changed the course of history. Reilly’s first mission involves undertaking a dangerous journey to Baku to investigate the Russian search for oil in the Middle East. Stars Sam Neill and Leo McKern.

results.title: Rehearsal
results.brief_description: Much of the work of an orchestra and its conductor is done in shirt sleeves, in an empty hall. In this film we go behind the scenes with conductor Paul Scherman as he prepares a Montreal orchestra for a performance of a new composition by Canadian composer Harry Somers. Mr. Somers himself is on hand to hear this rehearsal of his Suite for Harp and Chamber Orchestra.

results.title: Rehabilitation of Della Derlein
results.brief_description: Silent film documenting the case history of Della Derlein by Herbert Schoening MD. Della contracted meningitis resulting in deafness and paralysis and was admitted to the Kenny Institute. This film documents her rehabilitation showing the many disciplines involved and illustrates the successful outcome of the conservative steps, keeping the focus on the whole patient rather than on isolated parts of her body.

results.title: Regulating body temperature
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description: Compares ecto and endotherms. Discusses convection, conduction, radiation and insulation. Also mechanisms of sweating and shivering, and behavioural patterns relating to heat regulation. Humidity is discussed along with the role of the hypothalamus. Highlights the necessity of correct core temperature.
